Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Another New Paper:  Multiagent HyperNEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=29390171; y=0zq0DJrU9GtQG7NgThY9U5QYO8pavL6u8rZOXFS2LCaaAEOtSZeJ0oD_C-4

Ken, let me clear up that I'm pretty certain that the r(x) method will
work better than the alternative method I mentioned (supplying
position/role input to each phenotype as it is evaluated). The reason I
suggested it as a test was to rule out that there's a trivial method of
assigning roles that's more powerful than the r(x) method. 

> Mattias, that's a good question for comparison.  Because it is a 
> challenge to affect the holistic policy of a neural network with a 
> single input, I am guessing it would not work as well.  In contrast, 
> in HyperNEAT, the x position naturally has a holistic effect on the 
> substrate because the whole substrate is generated from that value.  
> Yet it is an empirical issue and I could be wrong; your idea might 
> work as well.

with regards,
mattias
